Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body and neck of a pale red-brown pottery vessel, the body is convex and slightly ribbed and the neck is cylindrical, the exterior is covered with a burnished red-brown slip and incised with one line of Coptic text.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell & J. Faiers
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394699) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394699)
